free_txt: M.M.

bib_record.title: Experimental Method for Neutron Elastic Scattering Cross-Section Measurement in Intermediate Energy Region at RCNP.

free_txt: A.Tamii, K.Hatanaka.
D.Satoh, Y.Iwamoto, T.Sato,A.Endo,Y.Sakamoto,
Y.Nakane, H.Nakashima.
M.Hagiwara, H.Iwase, T.Sanami.
H.Yashima.
H.Nakashima.
By subtracting the background spectrum and
cutting off the low-TOF channels corresponding to the
inelastic events, the elastic scattering neutrons were
extracted.
The cross sections were corrected by 4.0%, 5.0% and 10%
at 6., 8., and 15. degrees, respectively, for
contribution of low-excitation states of sample nucleus
,e.g. 2+ state at 4.44 MeV and 3- state at 9.64 MeV for
carbon. Correction factors for this contribution were
estimated by a coupled-channels calculation.
Intensity and energy spectrum of source neutrons
produced from the 7Li(p,n) reaction were measured by an
NE213 liquid organic scintillator located in the 0.deg.
direction and 15 m downstream from the target, with the
TOF method.
NE213 liquid organic scintillators of 12.7 cm diameter
and 12.7 cm thickness were employed to detect the
scattering neutrons at three angles 6., 8., 15. degrees
with 560-, 500-, and 400-cm flight-paths, respectively.
Thin plastic scintillators were mounted in front of the
NE213 scintillators as veto detectors to tag the
charged particles from the sample.Iron shadow blocks of
60 cm along the beam axis, 100 cm horizontally
orthogonal to the beam axis, and 20 cm in height
centered on the beam .
Detection efficiencies were calculated with the
SCINFULQMD code.
Proton beam current measured by the Faraday cup.
Proton beam of 137 MeV (maximum energy 400 MeV,
Proton-beam current 700 nA) was transported to lithium
target (1.0 cm thickness) placed in beam-swinger magnet
Neutron flux is on Fig.1 of J,NSTP,1,20,2011.
Peak of quasi-monoenergetic neutrons was observed
around 134 MeV with FWHM of the peak 3.0 MeV, and the
intensity 1.05*10**10 neutrons/sr/microC.
Set of collimators was used.
Flight -path 15 m.
Background was measured without sample.
Data on the pulse height, pulse shape, and TOF
were acquired event by event.
Gamma-ray events were segregated from the neutron
events by PSD.
Sample was set 10 m downstream from the lithium target.
Cylindrical samples of natural carbon (5 cm diameter x
5 cm length) were used.
Agreement with the UC Davis data at 127.5 MeV.
ENDF/B-VII.0 agrees well with the experimental data
in the forward angular region below 10 degrees in CM
system, while JENDL/HE-2007 gives about 30% lower
values. At angles over 10 degrees, ENDF/B-VII.0
underestimates the experimental data, and JENDL/HE-2007
agrees well.
Data are on Fig.5 of J,NSTP,1,20,2011.
Request for the data was sent 08-08-2011 to Daiki Satoh
satoh.daiki@jaea.go.jp .
